body: I'm unable to reproduce on Ubuntu, probably a distribution specific problem.

Same problem here, I hadn't any problem until yesterday when I make an upgrade, probably the issue is due to the new version of the following packages:

mesa (11.1.1-1 -> 11.1.2-1)
mesa-libgl (11.1.1-1 -> 11.1.2-1)
freetype2 (2.6.2-1 -> 2.6.3-1)

<del> Probably is related to last one, but I haven't being able to confirm it yet. </del>

**### CONFIRMED**
Issue is related to the new version of freetype2 (2.6.3-1).

Seems to be a freetype2 (2.6.3-1) thing on my end too using Arch - I had GitKraken giving blank white screen; downgrading it to cached `freetype2-2.6.2-1` makes the app usable again -- their changelog for the new version can be [found on SourceForge](https://sourceforge.net/projects/freetype/files/freetype2/2.6.3/).
@SangSatori Yup, I had the same issue! I used https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/Arch_Linux_Archive to grab the previous version of freetype2 and downgrade. Problem solved for now.
did someone file that over on the freetype2 bug tracker? That seems like an important thing to let them know... (sounds like their patch-version update is actually an API breaking major update)
@Pomax Good idea - I filed a bug about this on [NonGNU Savannah bug tracker](https://savannah.nongnu.org/bugs/index.php?47202).

I can't repeat the problem with ftview from current FreeType git.  Can you?  BTW, _which_ font is actually the problem?  Additionally, can you bisect FreeType to find the exact problem?  Otherwise, a backtrace would be helpful also.

I've got a report from user about this issue as well. The app which crashes contains Fontawesome glyphs on the start screen: https://github.com/antelle/keeweb
As you can see on the following screenshot, these glyphs are not rendered. The app is totally stuck after start. Currently it's using Electron v0.36.7 and fails.
Electron version v0.35.6 works as expected.
![screenshot from 2016-02-21 09-19-22](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/633557/13203201/92bf3572-d8c3-11e5-929f-b4fee04150f1.png)
I'll post more details about config once they are available.

issue.title: Atom does not function with the latest freetype2
issue.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Using `freetype 2.6.3` on the latest commits of Atom cause the editor to crash open opening. `freetype 2.6.2` works just fine.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Install `freetype 2.6.3`
2. Open Atom
### Versions

```
$ freetype-config --ftversion
2.6.3
$ atom --version && apm --version                                                                                              
1.7.0-dev-a613fa5
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.7.1
```

issue.title: npm 1.4 is required to build Atom.
issue.body:
``` bash
npm 1.4 is required to build Atom. An error (Error: spawn EACCES) occured when checking the version.
jprice at xxxxx in ~/atom/ ❮git:85456ad...❯ ✱ ⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅⋅ 21:58:15
 ❯❯ npm -v
1.4.28
```

Any ideas? Or am I stupid?

body:
+1 Same here, IIRC I had to use the ttf version of the font to fix the issue

Edit: Confirmed that downgrading to 2.6.2-1 solves the issue in Arch Linux

issue.title: Keybase GUI shows blank-ish dialogs

repository.name: client
repository.description: Keybase Go Library, Client, Service, OS X, iOS, Android, Electron

issue.body:
On Arch Linux using GNOME 3, the GUI just displays opaque blobs of color. I suspect one of them is key unlocking, but I can't really tell.

I don't seem to be able to use kbfs either, possibly as a result of this.

Initial dialog:
![Initial dialog](https://i.imgur.com/GSLHXRi.png)

When I click the icon:
![Grey blob](https://i.imgur.com/GtBonv0.png)

my log id: c13df03ad6cf0703c6c69f1c

body: I've filed an [Arch bug report](https://bugs.archlinux.org/task/48300) in case the maintainers want to downgrade the official package in the meantime.

Folks, this doesn't help me since I can't reproduce the issue!  I need a full stacktrace, ideally produced within gdb (executing the 'bt full' command after the crash) – and FreeType should be compiled _with_ debugging symbols, so that I get proper line numbers and variable values.
to help clear up a possible confusion: @lemzwerg leads the Freetype project, so if there's any information that can be provided that helps him concretely, that'd be awesome.

@lemzwerg I'm not able to see a stacktrace in our logs on the Keybase side of this issue (not sure why), but I can bisect the commit that causes it:  24aa9c665e3a8bbfbc5ae016354ffba7a1377fd3, "[autofit] Rewrite HarfBuzz interface to support character clusters."

There's a trace here:
https://gist.github.com/anonymous/14aaa3095b9cc8f31330

I think I've seen this before and it's similar to https://github.com/behdad/harfbuzz/issues/143. Which harfbuzz version does electron ship?

@heftig is it possible for you to rebuild FreeType with debugging symbols on, and then reproduce that stacktrace? (I'll admit I don't know how to do that.) I think that would help lemzwerg track down what's going on.

Edit: Oops my bad :)
